channel.title: Observers on Outcome documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Observers on Outcome documentation

item.title: `auto as_failure() const &`
item.description: Return the output from free function auto failure(T &&, ...) containing a copy of any errored state. The error state is accessed using const error_type &assume_error() const & noexcept . Requires: Always available. Complexity: Whatever that of error_type’s copy constructor is. Guarantees: None.

item.title: `bool has_error() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if an error is present. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_error() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if an error is present. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_exception() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if an exception is present. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_exception() const noexcept`
item.description: Always returns false for basic_result. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_failure() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if there is either an error or an exception. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_failure() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if there is either an error or an exception. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_lost_consistency() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if a preceding swap involving this object failed to preserve the strong guarantee. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_value() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if a value is present. Constexpr where possible. Alias for explicit operator bool() const noexcept . Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `bool has_value() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if a value is present. Constexpr where possible. Alias for explicit operator bool() const noexcept . Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `const error_type &&assume_error() const && noexcept`
item.description: Narrow contract const rvalue reference observer of the stored error. NoValuePolicy::narrow_error_check() is first invoked, then the reference to the error is returned. As a valid default constructed error is always present, no undefined behaviour occurs unless NoValuePolicy::narrow_error_check() does that. Note that if error_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::narrow_error_check(). Guarantees: An exception is never thrown.

item.title: `const error_type &&assume_error() const && noexcept`
item.description: Narrow contract const rvalue reference observer of the stored error. NoValuePolicy::narrow_error_check() is first invoked, then the reference to the error is returned. As a valid default constructed error is always present, no undefined behaviour occurs unless NoValuePolicy::narrow_error_check() does that. Note that if error_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::narrow_error_check(). Guarantees: An exception is never thrown.

item.title: `const error_type &&error() const &&`
item.description: Wide contract const rvalue reference observer of the stored error. NoValuePolicy::wide_error_check() is first invoked, then the reference to the error is returned. As a valid default constructed error is always present, no undefined behaviour occurs if NoValuePolicy::wide_error_check() returns. Note that if error_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::wide_error_check(). Guarantees: None.

item.title: `const value_type &&assume_value() const && noexcept`
item.description: Narrow contract const rvalue reference observer of any value present. NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check() is first invoked, then the reference to the value is returned. The convention is that hard undefined behaviour occurs if no value is actually present, however NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check() can do something to avoid that. Note that if value_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check(). Guarantees: An exception is never thrown.

Note that if value_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check(). Guarantees: An exception is never thrown.

Note that if exception_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::wide_exception_check(). Guarantees: None.

Note that if exception_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::narrow_exception_check(). As a valid default constructed exception is always present, no undefined behaviour occurs if NoValuePolicy::wide_exception_check() returns. Note that if exception_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::wide_exception_check(). Guarantees: None.

item.title: `exception_type failure() const noexcept`
item.description: Synthesising observer of the stored exception or error. If an exception is available, returns a copy of that directly. If an error is available, and not an exception, an ADL discovered free function auto basic_outcome_failure_exception_from_error(const EC &) is invoked. Default overloads for this function are defined in Outcome for std::error_code and boost::system::error_code, these return std::make_exception_ptr(std::system_error(ec)) and boost::copy_exception(boost::system::system_error(ec)) respectively. Requires: Both the traits is_error_code_available<T> and is_exception_ptr_available<T> are true. Complexity: Depends on basic_outcome_failure_exception_from_error(const EC &).

item.title: `explicit operator bool() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if a value is present. Constexpr where possible. Alias for bool has_value() const noexcept . Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `explicit operator bool() const noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if a value is present. Constexpr where possible. Alias for bool has_value() const noexcept . Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `failure_type<error_type, exception_type> as_failure() const &`
item.description: Return the output from free function auto failure(T &&, ...) containing a copy of any errored and/or excepted state. The error and/or exception state is accessed using const error_type &assume_error() const & noexcept and const exception_type &assume_exception() const & noexcept . Requires: Always available. Complexity: Whatever that of error_type’s and/or exception_type’s copy constructor is. Guarantees: None.

item.title: `static auto &&_error(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns a reference to the error in the implementation passed in. No checking is done to ensure there is an error. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `static auto &&_exception(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns a reference to the exception in the implementation passed in. No checking is done to ensure there is an error. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `static auto &&_value(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns a reference to the value in the implementation passed in. No checking is done to ensure there is a value. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `static bool _has_error(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if an error is present in the implementation passed in. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `static bool _has_error_is_errno(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if the error code in the implementation passed in has a domain or category matching that of POSIX errno. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `static bool _has_exception(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if an exception is present in the implementation passed in. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `static bool _has_value(Impl &&) noexcept`
item.description: Returns true if a value is present in the implementation passed in. Constexpr where possible. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Constant time. Guarantees: Never throws an exception.

item.title: `value_type &&assume_value() && noexcept`
item.description: Narrow contract rvalue reference observer of any value present. NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check() is first invoked, then the reference to the value is returned. The convention is that hard undefined behaviour occurs if no value is actually present, however NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check() can do something to avoid that. Note that if value_type is void, only a const overload returning void is present. Requires: Always available. Complexity: Depends on NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check(). Guarantees: An exception is never thrown.

item.title: `value_type &&assume_value() && noexcept`
item.description: Narrow contract rvalue reference observer of any value present. NoValuePolicy::narrow_value_check() is first invoked, then the reference to the value is returned. Guarantees: An exception is never thrown.
